div.p: LINKTYPE is a field in the Bibliography Database which indicates where an authorâ€™s STANDARDNAME should appear in the final bibliogitem. There are four options:

ul.li: Analytic -- indicates the author of a section of the work being cited (e.g. a short story, poem, journal article, or chapter, introduction or preface of a book).
Monographic -- indicates the author of the complete work being cited
Series -- indicates the author or editor of the series being cited

Subsidiary -- indicates that the Standard Name plays a secondary role within the context of the work being cited (e.g. editor of a collection of essays by a single author: this name will appear after the title of the work). In a volume of essays by Virginia Woolf edited by Germaine Greer, she is the Subsidiary author; in a volume of essays by various others which she collected and edited, she is Monographic.

div.p: Certain bibliogitems can be entered in a number of different ways depending upon the section of the work you are citing. Thus, LINKTYPE will be determined by MLA practice.

Spencer, Jane, ed and J. M. S. Tompkins, ed. Introduction. A Simple Story. By Elizabeth Inchbald. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1988. In this instance, the bibliogitem is the Introduction, so Spencer and Tompkins come first and second with Link Type=Analytic; Inchbald comes third with Link Type=Monographic.

Inchbald, Elizabeth. A Simple Story. Ed. Jane Spencer and J. M. S. Tompkins. Oxford: Oxford Univesrity Press, 1988. In this instance, the bibliogitem is the 1988 OUP edition of Elizabeth Inchbald's A Simple Story, so Inchbald comes first with Link Type=Monographic and Spencer and Tompkins follow with Link Type=Subsidiary.
Question: Can I have more than one Link Type per Standard Name?
Answer: No, you can modify the STANDARDNAME by one LINKTYPE only in each biblio entry.
Question: Can I have more than one Link Type per bibliogitem?
Answer: Yes. Depending on the type of work you are citing, you will sometimes have to enter a number of different standard names per bibliogitem, each with a different LINKTYPE.
